page.title: 06Arable Farming at New House
page.content: Mr Boffey lives at New House Farm with his wife and two schoolboy sons.He farms with one agricultural worker who has been there for 25 years. The farm is 300 acres, of which 285 are {arable.}There is a pretty pond and a small wood carefully maintained. When Mr Boffey was young his father ran the propety as a{mixed farm,}but Mr Boffey decided to give up milk production and keep{beef cattle}only. Later on he finished keeping animal altogether. This meant alterations to the buildings and to the field system (and resulted in much more{recreation) Many hedges have been pulled up to enlarge the fields,land drains have laid, and incovenient bumps and dips have been levelled so machines can operate efficiently.
